text.tspan: Lose Dying, Gain 1 Health, Gain Wounded
Dying - Can only make Death Checks. They cannot
perform Normal Actions, Reactions, or gain Health.
Attack Checks against them gain a +1 bonus. Dying
A Character can attempt to assist in stabilizing a
Character with the Dying Condition by making a
relevant Skill Check. The Dying Character gains +3
Exert - put in extra effort to
Skill Checks are used to determine
the outcome of many actions where the
result is uncertain. The Game Master
will determine which Skill and Attribute
should be used for the Check.
normally, the source of the Simplified
Skill Check will specify how to resolve
Success. Effects are Weakened and Suffer 1 Casting Exhaustion
Suffer 1 Casting Exhaustion or Effects are Weakened
You may choose Strengthened, if you do, Suffer 1 Casting Exhaustion
Casting Exhaustion - Each instance of Casting
Exhaustion Inflicts a -1 penalty to Casting Checks. At
the end of a Full Rest remove all Casting Exhaustion
Select an Invocation, perform your Casting Aspect, and
make a Casting Check. Alternatively, You may forgo
performing your Casting Aspect but suffer 1 Casting
Exhaustion. Outside of Combat Encounters you do not
need to Strain to perform this Action.
Channeling - The Character can not Cast another Invocation with a
duration. Additionally, any time that Character Suffers Damage they
must make a Simplified Casting Check. On Any Failure the Effects of
the Invocation end and the Channeling Condition is removed from the
Character. Additionally, as a Reaction the Character can choose to end
the Invocation and remove the Channeling Condition.
Casting Aspect - When Casting, you must perform the criteria of your
